definition: actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: Physical possessions are, indeed, a burden.
sentences.chinese: 物质形态的所有物的确是个包袱。

sentences.english: All our possessions are just a reflection of our inner self.
sentences.chinese: 我们所有的所有物都不过是内在自我的反映。

sentences.english: She tied up her few belongings into a bundle.
sentences.chinese: 她把她仅有的一些所有物绑成一捆。

sentences.english: You should not appropriate other people's belongings.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该把别人的所有物据为己有。

sentences.english: And now I would like my mode of transit returned to my possession.
sentences.chinese: 现在我将把我的交通方式归还到我的所有物中。

sentences.english: When the prisoner died, all of his belongings were destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 这个囚犯死后，他的一切所有物都被销毁了。

sentences.english: What is your most treasured possession?
These bowls are the only property they are allowed to own.
sentences.chinese: 这些钵，是他们唯一可以拥有的所有物。

sentences.english: You should not appropriate other people's belongings to yourself without their permission.
sentences.chinese: 你不应未经同意把别人所有物据为己有。

definition: to come when called (idiom); ready and compliant/always at sb's beck and call
pinyin: hu1 zhi1 ji2 lai2 , hui1 zhi1 ji2 qu4

definition: as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
precious darling (often refers to one's child)/sweetheart
